message_1:
Solve the inequality: 

4x - 7 > 25 

Show the solution set on a number line.
message_2:
To solve the inequality 4x - 7 > 25, follow these steps:

Step 1: Add 7 to both sides of the inequality.
4x - 7 + 7 > 25 + 7
4x > 32

Step 2: Divide both sides by 4.
4x/4 > 32/4
x > 8

The solution to the inequality is x > 8.

To represent this solution set on a number line:

1. Draw a number line with the numbers 7, 8, and 9 marked on it.
2. Place an open circle at 8, since x > 8 does not include the value 8.
3. Draw an arrow pointing to the right from the open circle at 8, indicating that all values greater than 8 are part of the solution set.

The number line representation shows that the solution set includes all values greater than 8.
